head.supplied: 19/1/98 ¶ Chas A Topp Esq MA ¶ Under Secretary ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have received from the Premier's Office two publications of the Royal Society of Antiquaries in Copenhagen, which had been addressed to Baro...

div.p: From Georg Luehmann to Charles Topp
G98/567, unit 979, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have received from the Premier's Office two publications of the Royal Society of Antiquaries in Copenhagen, which had been addressed to Baron Von Mueller. Should I hand them over to the Revd Mr Potter, as they are not botanical?
On 21 January 1898, Topp minuted: 'If they are sent as exchanges for this Government's publications they may be forwarded to the Public Library If not they may be handed to Mr Potter'.
Luehmann replied on 9 February: 'The Books have been handed over to the Trustees of Baron Von Mueller's estate, as I do not find any record that the Society of Antiquaries has received any Govt. publications'.
